{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rotavirus vaccines have been developed to protect against the most common genotypes of the virus. However, the introduction of these vaccines has led to a shift in the predominant genotypes of rotavirus in circulation. This is because the vaccines put selective pressure on the virus, leading to the emergence of non-vaccine genotypes. Therefore, the rotavirus vaccines have indeed changed the predominant rotavirus genotypes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
